name: Admiral (UK)
pedigree: Bred at Wye College
info: Bred at HRI Wye to increase the range of UK high alpha varieties; released in 1998
styles: Ales
trade: Very good high alpha hop

name: African Queen (RSA)
aroma: Dank, blueberries, stone fruit, black currant, gooseberries, bubble gum, lemongrass, watermelon and chilies
pedigree: A diploid seedling selected from a cross between 91J7/25 and an SA male 94US2/118
info: Daylight neutral hop. Works well with all hop-forward beers.  Also works well with Brettanomyces beers and subtle blended beers such as those with coffee, fruit, and spices.
styles: American and Belgian styles, modern IPAs, porters and stouts
trade: These South African hops have been highly controlled and priced exorbitantly high due to exclusivity (2018).

name: Ahtanum
pedigree: Open pollination. Developed by Select Botanicals
info: Its name is derived from the Ahtanum area near Yakima where the first hop farm was established in 1869 by Charles Carpenter
styles: American Ales, Pale Ale, IPA, Lager
trade: Used for its aromatic properties and moderate bittering

name: Akoya
pedigree: Zenith x Hopsteiner male
info: A classic aroma hop and was crossed in the Hopsteiner breeding program from the English variety Zenith and a male Hopsteiner breeding line. The aroma of raw hops can be described as herbal, citrus and tea-like, as well as slightly fruity with mint notes. Good resistance to diseases such as downy mildew and powdery mildew and Vertilicium wilt as well as drought stress. Main growing country is Germany. Early maturity.
styles: Alt, Pilsner, Maisbier, Lager, Helles, Kolsch, Golden Ale, Bitter, English IPA

name: Amarillo
pedigree: Privately grown and registered
info: Limited acreage
styles: American Ales, IPA, Belgian-style IPA, Double IPA
trade: Viewed as a Cascade type

name: Apollo
pedigree: Originally cultivated in 2000. Take hops variety 98001, cross that with USDA 19058m variety, then take the result and cross that with Zeus
info: This disease tolerant and high yielding (2600-3000 bls/ac) hops variety is not so accessible.
styles: American Ales
trade: Used toward the end of the boil it can contribute flavors and aromas of citrus, grapefruit, orange, pine, resin, and cannabis.

name: Aramis
aroma: Sweet, spicy notes, with hints of citrus and herbs
pedigree: The product of a 2002 cross between the French variety Strisselspalt and the English variety WGV (Whitbread Golding Variety)
info: From the Alsace region in France. The first variety to come from the Comptoir Agricole breeding program. It inherited Strisselspalt’s excellent aromas while providing a more plentiful and stable bittering quality.
styles: Pilsner, Lager, Wheat, Saison, India Pale Ale, Belgian Ales, Pale Ale, Porter
trade: The measure of its aroma and alpha characteristics make it appropriate for any and all kettle stages. Commercially it has been used in New Belgium Hop Kitchen’s French Aramis, a dry, refreshing India Pale Ale.

name: Aurora (SI)
pedigree: Diploid cross between Northern Brewer and a TG seedling of unknown origin
styles: All ales and some lagers
trade: Very suitable for extraction and for combination with other varieties in the brewing process

name: Azacca
aroma: Intense and tropical. Sustained impressions of citrus and very ripe mango, with notes of orchard fruit (pears, apples) and pine needles throughout.
pedigree: Washington, USA. The hop formerly known as #483 from the American Dwarf Hop Association
info: Named for the Haitian god of agriculture, Azacca™ boasts an intense tropical fruit profile.
styles: IPA
trade: Excellent aromatic qualities make Azacca™ a go-to hop for late and dry hop additions in a variety of styles

name: BOR (CZ)
pedigree: Hybrid posterity of Northern Brewer which was open pollinated by Saaz provenience components - released in the Czech Republic in 1994.
info: Main growing country is the Czech Republic. Medium to early maturing. Susceptible to powdery mildew

name: Bitter Gold
pedigree: Super-alpha variety Bitter Gold’s heritage comes from varieties Bullion, Brewer’s Gold, Comet and Fuggle.
info: Features an alpha-acid percentage higher than any of its parents and as high as Galena or Nugget, to which it is often compared. Released for production in 1999. Main growing country is the USA.
styles: Ale, Lager, Pilsner, Bitter, India Pale Ale
trade: Quite versatile and can be used as a bittering or flavour addition imparting strong flavours. Has no notable aroma

name: Boadicea
aroma: spicy, floral, dried fruit, ripe fruit
pedigree: Dwarf variety developed at Wye Hops Ltd. by Peter Darby.
info: Released in 2004 and known as the first aphid-resistant variety in the world. This hop also offers excellent resistance to wilt and downy mildew. A dwarf or hedgerow variety, which grows to a shorter height than traditional varieties, but yields the same amount and is easier to harvest. Main growing country is the UK. Medium to early maturing.
styles: Pilsner, English Style Pale

name: Bobek (SI)
pedigree: Derived from a Northern Brewer and Yugoslavian male TG
info: Seedling selected by Dr. Tone Wagner in Zalec, Yugoslavia in the mid-1970s
styles: English Style Ales, ESB, Lager, Pilsner & Belgian-style Ales
trade: Similar to Fuggle type

name: Bramling Cross (UK)
pedigree: Bred from a cross between Bramling (a traditional Golding variety) and a Manitoban wild hop seedling
info: Developed at Wye College by Professor Salmon
styles: All styles
trade: Often used to produce specialty craft beers

name: Bravo
pedigree: Developed by Hopsteiner Breeding Company and released in 2006
info: It is an excellent bittering variety but showcases pleasant fruit and sweet floral aroma characteristics too.
styles: American Style Pale Ales, or India Pale Ales
trade: The higher Co-Ho levels mean a not completely smooth bittering, but not as harsh as Chinook. (it's bittering properties are similar to Simcoe) A.dpuf

name: Brewer's Gold (DE)
pedigree: Open pollination of a wild Manitoba hop
info: Originally bred in the UK by professor E.S. Salmon; released in 1934
styles: Ales, German Lagers, Lambic, Saison, Bier de Garde
trade: Mainly used as a bittering hop

name: Brewer's Gold (US)
pedigree: A sibling of Bullion
info: Limited acreage in the US. Developed by Professor Salmon in 1934
styles: Ale, Pilsner, Lambic, Biere de Garde, Saison
trade: Mainly used as a bittering hop

name: Bullion
pedigree: A sibling to Brewer's Gold and was a seed collected off a female plant taken from a wild variety from Morden, Manitoba.
info: Bullion hops has been dubbed the first super alpha hops
styles: Stouts, Porter, and Scotch ales, but is also used in Bitters, and IPA's
trade: Bullion Hops, as you would guess, is a wonderful bittering hops.

name: Calypso
aroma: Crisp, fruity aroma. Flavour of Apples, pears, stone fruit and lime citrus.
pedigree: Yakima Valley bred, dual-purpose diploid hop with Hopsteiner lineage on both sides
info: Calypso features crisp, fruity aromas and flavors that exhibit elements of apple, pear and stone fruit brightened with hints of lime citrus.
styles: Ale, Stout, Barley Wine, American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, British Pale Ale/Bitter, British/American Strong Ale, IPA, Irish and Scottish Ales, Stout/Porter
trade: Despite its aroma-focused origins, it boasts a high alpha acid percentage.

name: Cascade
aroma: Medium intensity, floral, citrus and grapefruit
pedigree: Open pollination of a Fuggle seedling, derived from Fuggle and Serebrianka
info: 1st commercial hop from the USDA-ARS breeding program. It was bred in 1956 and released in 1972.
styles: US-style Ales, IPA, Porter & Barley wines, Witbier
trade: An aroma variety with well-balanced bittering potential. Good for dry hopping.

name: Cascade (NZ)
pedigree: Cross between English Fuggle and a male believed to have been a cross of Fuggle and Serebrianka
info: Released in 1972
styles: "New World" style Pale Ales, Summer Ales, IPA
trade: Performs well when used as a single variety across mutliple kettle additions.

name: Cashmere
aroma: Strong melon, fruity (lemon, lime peel, pineapple), coconut, and spicy notes
pedigree: Released by Washington State University in 2013, this hop is a direct daughter of Cascade.
info: Quite possibly its name refers to the silkiness imparted to its brews.
styles: IPA

name: Celeia (SI)
pedigree: Triploid hybrid between Stryian Golding, Aurora and a Slovenian wild hop
styles: English and Belgian-style Ales, Lager, Pilsner
trade: A high quality aroma variety with excellent bitterness and aroma qualities

name: Centennial
aroma: Medium intensity, floral and citrus tones
pedigree: Cross between Brewer's Gold and a USDA male
info: Popular among craft brewers; bred in 1974 and released in 1990
styles: All US-style Ales, IPA. Has been used with wheat beers
trade: Very balanced, sometimes calles a "Super"

name: Challenger (UK)
pedigree: A granddaughter of Northern Brewer; lineage also includes Northdown
info: Extremely versatile; widely used for both early and late kettle hopping
styles: English-Syle Ale, Porter, Stout, ESB, Bitter Barley Wine, Brown ales
trade: A dual purpose hop combining moderate alpha acid levels with a good kettle hop aroma

name: Chelan
pedigree: Developed by the John I Haas, Inc. breeding company and released in 1994
info: Similar to Galena but with higher alpha acids
styles: American Ale

name: Chinook
aroma: Medium intensity, spicy, piney and distinct with subtle tones of grapefruit
pedigree: Cross between Petham Golding and a high alpha USDA male
info: Increasingly popular among craft brewers; released in 1985
styles: US-style Pale Ale, IPA, Stout, Porter, Lager
trade: A high alpha hop with an acceptable aroma profile

name: Citra
aroma: Strong citrus and tropical tones - grapefruit, melon, lime, gooseberry, passion fruit and lychee
pedigree: Comprised of Hallertauer Mittlefrüh, US Tettnang, Brewer's Gold and East Kent Golding
info: Developed by the Hop Breeding Company of Yakima, Washington; released in 2007
styles: American-style Pale Ale, IPA, Double IPA
trade: New, up and coming variety, known for its intense flavor and aroma characteristics

name: Cluster
pedigree: Unknown - suggested that it arose from the hybridization of imported varieties and indigenous male hops
info: The oldest hop variety grown in the US
styles: Ales (Aroma), Lagers (Bittering) and Stout; often used in reproductions of historical US beer styles
trade: Excellent general purpose hop with balanced bittering and aroma potential

name: Columbus
pedigree: Bred and selected from Hopunion breeding
info: Part of "CTZ" with Tomahawk and Zeus
styles: US IPA, US Pale Ale, Stout, Barley Wine, Lager
trade: Popular oil profile, great for dry hopping

name: Crystal
pedigree: Triploid variety from German Hallertau with contributions from Cascade, Brewer's Gold and Early Green; a half-sister of Mt. Hood and Liberty
info: Primarily grown in Oregon; released in 1993
styles: Lager, Kölsch, ESB, Pilsner, IPA, Pale Ale & Belgian Ales
trade: The most pungent of the new triploid Hallertau family

name: Delta
aroma: Mild and pleasant aroma that is slightly spicy with a hint of citrus
pedigree: A cross between Fuggle and a male variety derived from Cascade.
styles: American Pale Ale, American India Pale Ale

name: Dr. Rudi (NZ)
pedigree: Dr. Rudi is a triploid variety bred from New Zealand Smoothcone. Its name was changed to Dr. Rudi in 2012.
info: Developed at the New Zealand Horticultural Research Centre (now New Zealand Institute for Plant and Food Research) and released in 1976 as "Super Alpha"
styles: Lager, India Pale Ale
trade: Dr. Rudi works well in single-hopped beers or in conjunction with multiple aroma varieties.

name: East Kent Golding (UK)
pedigree: Developed by clonal selection from 1970 on, starting from Canterbury Whitebine
info: First planted in the US in 1995
styles: All English style Ales, Belgian style Ales
trade: Classic English Ale hop which has been used in kettle and dry hopping

name: Ekuanot
aroma: Citrus, Tropical fruit, Fruity, Herbal, Green pepper, melon
pedigree: Developed by Hop Breeding Company and released in 2014, HBC 366
info: The variety was named after the spring and fall equinox as it bursts out of the spring soil in vibrant yellow color and gradually matures to deep green by fall harvest.
styles: American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, British Pale Ale/Bitter, IPA, Irish and Scottish Ales, Pale Lager, Trappist/Belgian Ale, Wheat Beers
trade: An up-and-coming hop with pronounced aroma, tight cone structure and notably high oil content. Noted for an indescribably unique berry-and-fresh-pepper character.

name: El Dorado
pedigree: Developed by CLS Farms, LLC in 2008 and released in 2010
info: Has surprising characteristics due to its growth in a cooler climate
styles: Pale Ales

name: Ella (AU)
aroma: Floral and subtle spice notes, such as star anise
pedigree: Ella’s™ story is similar to half-sister Galaxy™; however this time the male parent hop was derived from Spalt.
info: Reminiscent of, yet distinctly different from, noble European varieties - one of the most versatile hops available.
styles: Pilsners, Lagers
trade: Ella can give off a very spicy, earthy, almost anise like aroma in a boil and provides a bright, tropical fruit and citrus scent when dry hopped.

name: Enigma (AU)
aroma: ‘Pinot Gris’, ‘raspberries’, and ‘redcurrant’, through to rock melon and light tropical fruit.
pedigree: A descendant of the German tettnang hop
info: After winning over Aussie brewers with her beguiling ways in trial brews, we expanded our plantings at our Tasmanian farm in 2013, ready for her first generous crop in 2015.
trade: Dry hop or add her late in the brew to maximise her flavour and aroma potential.

name: Eureka
aroma: Flavors of citrus, peach and pine, aromas of stone fruit and mandarin
pedigree: It is the progeny of varietals Apollo and Merkur.
info: Eureka is a fairly new variety with very strong bittering qualities and a complex and robust flavor and aroma profile
styles: Imperial India Pale Ale, India Pale Ale, American Ales, American Red, Saison
trade: It is said to impart flavors of citrus, resin, tropical and dark fruit along with aromas of grapefruit rind, citrus and tangerine.

name: First Gold (UK)
aroma: Similar to Golding, slightly spicy but smooth
pedigree: Cross-pollination of the Whitbread Golding variety and a dwarf male
info: First commercial dwarf hop designed for aroma consideration in England
styles: Ale, ESB
trade: Suitable as a general kettle hop and also for late and dry hopping in all types of beer

name: Fuggle (UK)
pedigree: A chance seedling raised in England
info: Once a predominant hop in England, now reserved for aroma use in conjunction with high alpha types
styles: English and Belgian-style Ales, ESB, Bitter, Lager, Lambic
trade: Long associated with English ale brewing.

name: Fuggle (US)
pedigree: A chance seedling
info: Selected in 1861 by Richard Fuggle. Known as Styrian Golding in Slovenia and UK Fuggle in England
styles: Any English-style beer, US Ale, Lambic
trade: Traditional English-type aroma hop

name: Galaxy (AU)
pedigree: This Australian triploid cultivar was bred in 1994 by Hop Products Australia and is a cross between a female tetraploid hop (J78) and a male plant, descendant of the variety Perle.
info: Highly versatile, Galaxy can be used in almost all varieties of beer.
styles: All styles
trade: Typically used as a late addition - the aroma and flavor characteristics become more pronounced the later the addition.

name: Galena
pedigree: Open pollination of Brewer's Gold
info: Developed in the Idaho state breeding program in 1968; released in 1978
styles: Most English-style and American-style Ales
trade: Excellent high alpha hop with balanced bittering and aroma characteristics

name: Gimmli (DE)
info: The variety 'Gimmli' is characterized by its tamed growth. It is a socalled "dwarf-variety"
trade: The unbeatable advantages of this variety lie in the growth character!

name: Glacier
pedigree: Offspring of Elsasser
info: Released as a public variety in 2000 by Dr. Stephen Kenny of Washington State University. Chosen for its low co-humulone and good yield potential
styles: Pale Ale, ESB, English-style Pale Ale, Porter, Stout
trade: Excellent variety with balanced bittering properties and a good aroma profile

name: Golding (SI)
pedigree: A traditional Slovenian hop variety belonging to the Fuggle ecotype
info: Known in Slovenia as the Savinja Golding, this variety is the same as the English Fuggle
styles: English and Belgian-style Ales, Lagers, Pilsners
trade: A world-renowned aroma hop with widespread usage in both ales and lager brewing

name: Golding (US)
pedigree: East Kent Golding
info: UK Golding clones have been introduced for growing in WA and OR. There are no longer any BC Golding hops grown.
styles: All English-style beers, especially Bitters and Pale Ales, Belgian-style Ales, Barley Wine
trade: Popular among ale breweries in the US

name: Green Bullet (NZ)
aroma: spicy, dried fruit characters; high levels of floral oil that complements and balances the piney resinous hop character
pedigree: Green Bullet is a triploid alpha variety bred by open cross pollination of the New Zealand "Smoothcone" variety
info: Used extensively as a utility brew house workhorse and found in breweries across the world.
styles:
Pale Ale
Bitter
Stout
Lagers
Irish Red Ale
Porter
Pilsner
India Pale Ale
trade: This “go to” hop is a traditional bittering type that now finds applications throughout the brewery from late additions through the hop back/ whirlpool and dry hopping.

name: HBC 291
pedigree: Experimental variety developed by Hop Breeding Company.
info: Often described as a "super noble" variety

name: Hallertau (US)
aroma: Very mild, slightly flowery and spicy
pedigree: Traditional German variety, originally selected in the area of the same name
info: Limited acreage grown in the US
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Wheat, Munich Helles
trade: Traditional German aroma hop

name: Hallertau Mittelfrüh (DE)
aroma: Mild with distinct floral, hop and citrus tones
pedigree: Traditional local variety in the Hallertau region
info: At one time, the major Hallertau landrace variety with a highly acclaimed aroma profile
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Weizen, Belgian-style Ales, Alt, Lambic, Kölsch, Munich Helles
trade: The classic German aroma hop associated with Bavarian-style lager beers, distinguished by an intense, pleasantly harmonic bitterness.

name: Herkules (DE)
pedigree: Cross between Hallertauer Taurus and a powdery mildew resistant Hüll male breeding line
info: Bred at the Hop Research Cwnter in Hüll, Germany; released in 2005
styles: Pilsners, German-style Lagers, Alt
trade: Very high bitter value

name: Hersbrucker (DE)
aroma: Mild to medium, pleasant, floral and slightly fruity
pedigree: Traditional German landrace variety selected in the Hersbruck area
info: Has developed into the variety with the largest acreage - grown throughout the Hallertau, Spalt and Hersbruck areas
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Weizen Bock, Wheat, Belgian Ales, Kölsch, Munich Helles
trade: A noble aroma type

name: Horizon
pedigree: Half-sister of Nugget
info: Commercially grown in small quantities, gaining popularity in the craft brew industry; developed in Oregon, 1970
styles: All ales and lagers
trade: Medium alpha, good aroma, dual purpose hop. Low co-humulone results in clean tasting beer

name: Jarrylo
pedigree: Jarrylo hops are a dwarf hop variety and were cultivated from the same hop association that brought us Summit hops and Azacca hops.
info: Jarrylo® (pronounced Jar-ril-low) is named after Jarilo, the Slavic god of fertility and springtime.
styles: Pale Ales, Saisons and Belgians.
trade: Despite its upbringing estranged from the IPA cool kids, Jarrylo™ offers complex fruit flavors that make for a very unique Pale Ale and blend seamlessly into an IPA. Indeed, this is how commercial brewers have chosen to use it.

name: Lemondrop
aroma: Lemon, mint, green tea, slightly melon
pedigree: Originated from a cross between Cascade and USDA 19058 male
info: This Super Cascadian hop has a unique combination of fruity and herbal notes
styles: IPAs, Pale Ales and Saisons, American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, Hybrid Beers, IPA, Pale Lager, Trappist/Belgian Ale, Wheat Beers
trade: Equipped with the elusive true-lemon character, Lemondrop boasts fantastic lemony-citrus aroma for late kettle additions or dry hopping.

name: Liberty
pedigree: Cross between tetraploid female hop cultivar Hallertau Mittlefruh and downy mildew resistant male. A half-sister tot Ultra, Mt. Hood and Crystal
info: 1 of 4 triploid Hallertau varieties released, most closely rsembles the Hallertau cultivar
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Kölsch, Wheat
trade: Close similarities to imported German aroma varieties, especially Hallertau

name: Lublin (PL)
aroma: Mildly spicy, herbal, reminiscent of its noble Saaz hop origins
pedigree: Lublin was bred from Saaz and carries with it many of the same characteristics
info: Polands most widely grown hops. Poland has roughly 2,500 hectares of hops which is mostly grown around the city of Lublin, including Pulawy.
styles: Golden Ale, Lager, Pilsener, Strong Lager
trade: Lublin hops can be used for bittering, flavor, and aroma/finishing additions to your brew kettle.

name: Magnum (DE)
pedigree: Bred at the Hop Research Institute in Hüll
info: The main high alpha variant grown in Germany
styles: Ale, Lager, Stout, Pilsner types
trade: High alpha with good yields and disease resistance

name: Magnum (US)
pedigree: Bred at the Hop Research Institute in Hüll, a cross between Galena and a German male
info: Limited US acreage but widely gron in Germany
styles: All Ales and Lagers
trade: Gaining acceptance as a clean bittering hop

name: Mandarina Bavaria (DE)
aroma: Specific aroma descriptors include fruity and citrus, specifically distinct tangerine and citrus flavors
pedigree: Bred at the Hop Research Institute in Hüll
info: Mandarina Bavaria displays pleasant fruitiness in finished beers
styles: American IPA and variants, black ales, saisons, Brett fermentations, and other beers where a definite fruity and strongly hoppy character is beneficial
trade: A tangerine machine when used for late, whirlpool, and dry hop additions

name: Mapuche (AR)
aroma: Grapefruit, blueberry, red fruits, peach and apricot
pedigree: Grown in the Upper Black River Valley (39th parallel)
info: Grown "exclusively" for Leffe
styles: Pale Ale, IPA

name: Melba (AU)
aroma: Clean spicy bitterness, aromas of passionfruit, grapefruit and citrus.
pedigree: Bred by Ellerslie Hop Australia
info: Affectionately known as “The Dame of Hops”
styles: New World APA and IPA, Australian Ale, American Pale Ale, American IPA/DIPA, Amber Ale... could even make for an interesting Saison.
trade: When used as an early addition, it is said to impart a clean and somewhat spicy bitterness. When used as an flavor or aroma addition though, properties of passionfruit, grapefruit and citrus come to the fore.

name: Merkur (DE)
aroma: Strong with earthy, floral and spicy tones
pedigree: Cross between Hallertauer Magnum and 81/8/13
info: Strong resistance to powdery mildew
styles: German and American Lagers
trade: High alpha variety with high bitter value, good aroma, strong storage stability and low co-humulone

name: Millennium
pedigree: Descendent of Nugget
info: Released by Jon I. Haas in 2000
styles: Ales, Stout, Barley Wine
trade: High alpha, very similar to Columbus and Nugget

name: Mosaic
aroma: Citrus, pine, earth, herbal, mint, bubblegum, blueberry, lime peel, black pepper
pedigree: Developed by Hop Breeding Company and released in 2012
info: Mosaic is named in honor of the artistic assortment of aromas and flavors this hop is capable of presenting.
trade: Used in brewing both for its aromatic and bitter qualities

name: Motueka (NZ)
pedigree: Bred by crossing a New Zealand breeding selection with Saazer parentage
info: This hop offers a unique aroma and flavor making if suitable for producing bigger more traditional style Lagers, especially Bohemian Pilsner
styles: European Lagers, Belgian and English Ales, Pilsner
trade: Excelllent in many applications and when employed in multiple additions from a single hop bill

name: Mt. Hood
pedigree: Triploid seedling of Gr. Hallertauer Mittelfrüh, half sister to Ultra, Liberty and Crystal
info: Released in the US in 1989
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Alt, Munich Helles, Wheat
trade: Aroma hop variety with similarities to the German Hallertau and Hersbrucker varieties.

name: Mt. Rainier
aroma: Excellent floral/noble aromas, with citrus and licorice tones
pedigree: Complex parentage including Hallertau, Galena, and Fuggle
info: Will only be grown through the 2010 season
trade: Similar to Hallertau, but with more bittering strength

name: Nelson Sauvin (NZ)
pedigree: A triploid variety bred from NZ "smoothcone" and a selected NZ male
info: Developed at the New Zealand HortResearch Centre; released in 2000
styles: American Pale Ale, Lager
trade: Considered by some as 'extreme', this hop is often used in specialty craft and seasonal beers

name: Newport
pedigree: Open pollination
info: Released in 2002
styles: Ales, Stout, Barley Wine
trade: Viewed as a high-bittering alpha hop

name: Northdown (UK)
aroma: Mild, pleasant and delicate hop aroma
pedigree: First generation selection from Northern Brewer and downy resistant, German male
info: Released in the early 1970s with relatively high alpha acids; an "aunt" to UK Challenger and UK Target
styles: All Ales, Porter
trade: A true dual-purpose hop with moderate bittering potential and excellent flavor/aroma characteristics

name: Northern Brewer (DE)
pedigree: One of the original high alpha hops bred in England; a cross between an American wild hop and English male
info: Bred in England and later grown in Belgium, Spain, Germany and the US
styles: ESB, Bitter, English Pale Ale, Porter, Lager
trade: A true dual purpose hop

name: Northern Brewer (US)
aroma: Medium intensity with Evergeen, wood & mint overtones
pedigree: Canterbury Golding female and the male OB21
info: Bred in England, 1934; limited acreage in the US
styles: All English-styles, esp. Porters, Ales, Kölsch, and Munich Helles
trade: A true dual purpose hop with good aroma

name: Nugget
pedigree: Lineage incldues Brewer's Gold, Early Green and Canterbury Golding
info: 2nd largest hop variety in Oregon
styles: Ales, Stout, Barley Wine, Saison, Biere de Garde
trade: A high alpha hop with a good aroma profile

name: Opal (DE)
aroma: Balanced fruity, hoppy, flowery, citrusy and herbal characteristics
pedigree: Bred at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany
info: Registered in 2001
styles: Summer Ales, Light Ales, Belgian-style Ales, Wheat
trade: Good aroma type

name: Pacific Gem (NZ)
pedigree: Triploid alpha type bred from NZ "Smoothcone", Californian Late Cluster and Fuggle
info: Developed through the hop breeding program at the New Zealand HortResearch Centre; released in 1987
styles: European Lagers, Ales, Dry Stouts
trade: High alpha hop with a pleasant aroma and a high bitterness level; typically a first hop addition

name: Pacific Jade
pedigree: Triploid alpha variety from a cross between First Choice and Saazer
trade: It is also esteemed for its aroma profile making it one of the borderline dual purpose hops

name: Pacifica (NZ)
pedigree: A triploid aroma type bred through open pollination of Hallertau Mittelfrüh
info: Developed through the hop breeding program at the New Zealand HortResearch Centre; released in 1994
styles: Lager, Pale Ale, Bock, Porter, Stouts
trade: An exciting "finger print" replica bred from the famous Hallertau Mittelfrüh hop variety.

name: Palisade
pedigree: Tettnang parentage
info: Cultivar bred by Yakima Chief Ranches
styles: English and American-style ales
trade: Used for its aromatic properties and moderate bittering

name: Perle (DE)
pedigree: Bred at the Hüll Hop Research Institute from the English Northern Brewer variety
info: The most popular German-grown hop variety; released in 1978
styles: Pale Ale, Porter, Stout, Lager, Pilsner, Weizen, Ale, Alt, Kölsch, Munich Helles
trade: Highly acceptable aroma variety with balanced bittering

name: Perle (US)
pedigree: Bred from English Northern Brewer
info: Bred at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany; mainatins excellent storage stability
styles: Pale Ale, Porter, Stout, Lager, Weizen, Alt, Barley Wine, Kölsch
trade: Often used as a dual purpose hop

name: Phoenix (UK)
pedigree: Seedling of the high alpha variety, Yeoman
info: Developed at Wye College
styles: Ales
trade: Has performed well as a replacement for high alpha or dual purpose hops early in the boil

name: Pilgrim (UK)
aroma: Distinctly hoppy with pleasant lemon tones
pedigree: Descendent of First Gold and Herald
info: Bred at the Horticultural Research Institute in Wye, England; released in 2000
styles: Ales

name: Pioneer (UK)
pedigree: Sister to English Herald, distant relative to Yeoman
styles: Ales, ESB
trade: Combines a pleasant aroma with a moderatly high alpha acid content

name: Premiant (CZ)
aroma: Pleasant, mild, neutral bittering, slightly spicy
pedigree: Bred from Saaz and released in 1996
info: Premiant has a relatively high alpha content for Czech varieties.
styles: Pilsner, Ale, Pale Ale, Belgian Ales, Belgian Pilsners

name: Pride of Ringwood (AU)
pedigree: 2nd generation from the English Pride of Kent
info: Bred in Australia and grwon since the 1960s
styles: Australian lagers
trade: Predominantly used as a bittering hop but contains interesting aramotic qualities

name: Progress (UK)
pedigree: Seedling of WGV crossed with O.B.79 (which is also the grandfather of Target)
info: One of the few UK aroma hops purposefully bred in a modern breeding program
styles: Ale, Bitter, ESB, Porter
trade: A robust aroma hop with moderate bittering potential

name: Rakau (NZ)
aroma: Stone fruit and fig characteristics; fresh orchard fruits, specifically apricot with some resinous pine needle
pedigree: Re-released in 2007 from the New Zealand hop breeding program
info: Rakau is often described as “the whole orchard.”
styles: New World styles of ales and lagers
trade: Rakau performs best when used in combination of late additions and dry hopping.

name: Riwaka (NZ)
pedigree: Triploid variety bred through the crossing of "Old Line" Saazer and specially developed New Zealand breeding selections
info: Released by New Zealand HortResearch Centre in 1997
styles: Pale Ale, Pilsner
trade: Suitable where traditional Saazer types would be employed. Riwaka imparts its own zeal when used as a late kettle addition.

name: Saaz (CZ)
aroma: Very mild with pleasant hoppy notes
pedigree: Czech aroma landrace variety
info: The predominant Czech variety
styles: Pilsner, Lagers, Belgian-Style Ales, Lambic
trade: The classical "noble" aroma hop with long and strong traditions. Associated with the renowned Pilsner Lager.

name: Saaz (US)
pedigree: US equivalent of the longstanding Czech variety
info: High ambient temperatures can have an adverse effect on yields
styles: Pilsner, Lager, Wheat, Belgian-style Ales
trade: Available in small quantities

name: Santiam
aroma: Slightly spicy with herbal and floral tones
pedigree: Triploid aroma selection from a diploid Tettnang clone and a tetraploid Hallertauer
info: Limited but stable acreage; released in 1997
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Belgian Tripel, Kölsch, Bock, Munich Helles
trade: American aroma hop that contains noble hop characteristics

name: Saphir (DE)
aroma: Distinct aroma with flowery and fruity tones
pedigree: Bred at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany
info: Released in 2002
styles: German lagers, Pilsners, Belgian-style Ales
trade: Fine aroma variety

name: Simcoe
pedigree: Bittering and aroma type cultivar
info: Known as a bittering hop with good aroma characteristics; bred by Yakima Chief Ranches
styles: American-style Ales, Pale ale, IPA, Double IPA
trade: Used for aromatic and bittering properties

name: Sladek (CZ)
aroma: Fruity flavor profile with essences of peach, passion fruit, and grapefruit
pedigree: The variety Sladek contains genetically 30% of Saaz hops
info: Sladek means “beer brewer”
styles: Lagers
trade: Recommendable to use this hops at least 20 minutes before the end of the brewing process

name: Smaragd (DE)
aroma: Predominantly fruity with hoppy and flowery tones
pedigree: Bred at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany
styles: Ales, Alt, Kölsch
trade: A fine aroma variety with high bitter value

name: Sorachi Ace
pedigree: Cross between Brewer's Gold, Saazer - OP and Beikei No. 2 male
info: Seeding selection made in Japan
styles: Belgian Wit, IPA, Pale Ale, Beglian Saison
trade: An extremely unique high alpha aroma variety with great bittering characteristics

name: Spalt (DE)
aroma: Mild and pleasant with flowery, fruity and spicy tones
pedigree: Traditional German landrace variety selected and grown in the area of the same name
info: Only grown in the Spalt area, limited acreage
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Alt, Kölsch, Munich Helles
trade: Traditional noble aroma hop with average bitter value and very good aroma, provides a distinct hoppy flavor

name: Spalter Select (DE)
aroma: Very fine Spalter type aroma with fruity and flowery tones, imparts a distinct hoppy tang
pedigree: Bred from Hallertauer Mittlefrüh and Spalt as a disease resistant Spalt type.
info: Bred at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany; released in 1991
styles: Lager, Alt, Kölsch
trade: Bred to be like the Spalt/Tettnang/Saaz group

name: Sterling
aroma: Herbal and spicy with a hint of floral and citrus
pedigree: Lineage includes Saaz, Cascade, Brewer's Gold, Early Green and German open-pollination
info: Limited but stable acreage; released in 1998
styles: Pilsner, Lager and Belgian-style Ales
trade: Finding favor as a Saaz replacement

name: Strisselspalt (FR)
pedigree: Major aroma hop of the Alsace area of France near Strasbourg
info: Worldwide acceptance as good aroma hop. similar to Hersbrucker, but preffered by some breweries
styles: Pilsner, Lager, Wheat, Belgian-style Ales, Saison and Biere de Garde
trade: Very good aroma hop

name: Summit
aroma: Distinct spiciness with earthy, onion, garlic and citrus characteristics
pedigree: Cross pollination of Lexus and an unspecified male; derived from numerous plants including Zeus, Nugget and male USDA varieties
info: Bred by the American Dwarf Hop Association in the United States, released in 2003
styles: IPA, Pale Ale, Imperial IPA
trade: Great late addition hop

name: Super Galena
pedigree: Developed in 1998 by Roger Jeske in Yakima Washington. Galena was crossed with an Open Pollinated Nugget Hops variety
info: Super Galena is very comparable to Galena Hops in character. It is a bittering hops known for its clean and crisp bitterness.
styles: IPA, Pale Ale, Stout
trade: Super Galena hops is commonly used as as bittering agent in beer.

name: Target (UK)
aroma: Pleasant but intense English hop aroma
pedigree: Second generation selection from Northern Brewer and a male, English Golding seedling
info: Predominant UK variety normally bred for bittering, but widely used for its high alpha content and aroma.
styles: All Ales and Lagers
trade: A good high alpha variety with an acceptable kettle hop aroma

name: Taurus (DE)
pedigree: Cross between 82/39/37 and 85/54/15M
info: Bred at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany
styles: German-style Ales, Lagers
trade: Ultra high-alpha variety of Hallertau, granting strong bitterness

name: Tettnang (DE)
aroma: Mild and pleasant with balanced aroma impressions
pedigree: Traditional German landrace variety
info: Largely confined tot the Tettnang area and belonging to the Saaz variety group
styles: Lager, Ale, Pilsner, Weizen, Lambic, Alt, Kölsch, Munich Helles, Belgian-style Ales
trade: Traditional, noble aroma hop

name: Tettnang (US)
pedigree: A traditional German land-race variety
info: Similar to Fuggle; popular with craft brewers
styles: Pilsner, Lager, Wheat, American-style Ales
trade: A true noble aroma variety

name: Topaz (AU)
aroma: Light tropical fruit (some say lychee) flavours. fleshy citrus and apricot, with a strong "dank" overtone and a hint of sulfur
pedigree: Australian high alpha acid variety crossed with pollen from a Wye college male
info: An old standby in the Australian bittering hop program, but recently being treated more for it's aroma potential.
trade: Can be used for bittering as an early addition and as aroma in a late addition

name: Tradition (DE)
aroma: Medium intensity, floral and herbal tones
pedigree: A cross between Hallertauer Gold and 75/15/106M originating in Germany
info: Bred for disease resistance at the Hop Research Center in Hüll, Germany; registered in 1993
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Wheat, Weizen

name: Ultra
pedigree: Bred by the hops research program in Corvallis, Oregon in 1983 and released in 1995 by the USDA, Ultra is a triploid seedling of Hallertau mf. and half sister to Mt. Hood, Liberty and Crystal.
info: It is resistant to downy mildew and features small size cones.
styles: Pilsners, Wheat and Bock beers
trade: Ultra is related to traditional German varieties and can be utilized in similar applications.

name: Vanguard
pedigree: Cross between USDA accessions 21285 (a Hallertau Mittelfrüh daughter) and 64037M
info: Similar to Hallertau Mittelfrüh; released for cultivation in 1997
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bock, Kölsch, Wheat, Munich Helles, Belgian-style Ales
trade: Used for its aromatic properties and low co-humulone

name: Vic Secret (AU)
pedigree: Developed in 2000 in Victoria, Australia alongside sister variety Topaz
info: Vic Secret had her first commercial harvest in 2013.
styles: Pale Ale, India Pale Ale, Stout, Porter
trade: Vic Secret’s is best utilized via whirlpool and dry hopping. It is also worth noting that late kettle additions impart a wonderful earthiness, but the fruitiness doesn’t come through.

name: Waimea (NZ)
pedigree: Released from The New Zealand Institute for Plant & Food Research Limited’s Motueka Research Centre, as a granddaughter to Pacific Jade
styles: American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, IPA, Pale Lager, Trappist/Belgian Ale
trade: Waimea is well-suited to dual purpose applications from early kettle additions right through to dry hopping

name: Wakatu (NZ)
pedigree: Triploid aroma type bred by open pollination of Hallertau Mittelfrüh and a NZ derived male
info: Bred at the NZ Riwaka HortResearch Centre; released in 1988
styles: Lager, Pilsner, Bitter, Ales, Bock
trade: Less spicy than the Hallertau Mittelfrüh; able to reatain its clean taste even in older beers

name: Warrior
pedigree: Bred by Yakima Chief Ranches
info: Very grower friendly
styles: Pale Ale, IPA
trade: Stable, high alpha hop

name: Whitbread Golding Variety (UK)
aroma: Moderate, sweet, pleasant and slightly fruity
pedigree: Open pollination of Bates Brewer
info: Bred in 1911
styles: Pale Ale, Wheat
trade: Sometimes used as a distinctive dry hop

name: Willamette
pedigree: Triploid seedling of the English Fuggle variety
info: Well established in the US industry; currently the most widely grown aroma hop in the US
styles: All English-style Ales, US Pale Ale, US Brown Ale, American Lager
trade: A quality hop aroma
